Uses of Class
vfsCore.Hierarchy

  • Packages that use Hierarchy 
    Package Description
    vfsCore  
    vfsCore.visitors  

    • Uses of Hierarchy in vfsCore

      Subclasses of Hierarchy in vfsCore 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  File
      this is a class representing one of the two types of hierarchy element.
      class  Folder
      this is a class representing one of the two types of hierarchy element.
      Methods in vfsCore that return Hierarchy 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Hierarchy Folder.findChild(java.lang.String path)
      Method to follow a path in the current Hierarchy and return the Hierarchy element at the given path will be used in every method that need to access a specific directory or file in the hierarchy
      Hierarchy CoreIO.getHierarchyFromBytes(byte[] hierarchyBytes)
      converts a correctly-formatted byte array to a Hierarchy object, de-serializing it.
      Hierarchy CoreIO.loadHierarchyTreeFromFile()
      loads a Hierarchy from a .dsk file (VFS file on the host system)
      Methods in vfsCore that return types with arguments of type Hierarchy 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<Hierarchy> Folder.getChildren() 
      java.util.ArrayList<Hierarchy> Core.searchFile(java.lang.String search)
      returns an array containing all the Files objects whose name is equal to the string given as an argument
      Methods in vfsCore with parameters of type Hierarchy 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Folder.addChild(Hierarchy newChild)
      Add a child to the hierarchy, might be a folder or a file
      boolean Core.copyElement(Hierarchy original, Folder destinationFolder)
      copy a Hierarchy element to another Hierarchy element
      void Core.deleteFolderOfHierarchy(Hierarchy folder)
      the "tool" method to delete a hierarchy given in parameter
      byte[] CoreIO.getHierarchyBytes(Hierarchy h1)
      converts the Hierarchy to a byte array Here we want to add the serialized version of the hierarchy to an already existing file (the .dsk), at an arbitrary position.
      boolean Folder.hasAsChild(Hierarchy potentialChild)
      checks if a Hierarchy element is contained in a sub-folder of the current Hierarchy
      Folder FolderTest.initFolder(Hierarchy h1) 
      void Folder.removeChild(Hierarchy child)
      remove a child from the hierarchy We have to override this method for folder concrete class to be able to return an array list of the subfiles (including those in subfolders) to delete them from VFS Overriding it for file concrete class to return the address of the deleted file from VFS, for the core to really delete it
      void CoreIO.saveHierarchyToFile(Hierarchy h1)
      Allows us to save a hierarchy object in a .dsk file, without damaging the data already stored in it.
      Method parameters in vfsCore with type arguments of type Hierarchy 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
